channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Zhipu AI’s Market Cap Surges Past HK$150 Billion, Nearly Tripling Its IPO Valuation
item.description: Zhipu AI’s stock surged past HK$150 billion in market value as speculation intensifies that OpenRouter’s mysterious “Pony Alpha” model may be its upcoming GLM-5.

item.title: Increased login errors for ChatGPT
item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Login (Operational)

item.title: Elevated errors on Opus 4.6 Fast Mode
item.description: Feb 10, 22:11 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating the issue.

item.title: Increased error rates for ChatGPT Go
item.description: Status: MonitoringMitigation has been successfully implemented and error rates have returned to normal levels. We are continuing to monitor the system to ensure sustained stability.Affected components Conversations (Degraded performance)

item.title: 6 Actively Exploited Zero-Days Patched by Microsoft With February 2026 Updates
item.description: Microsoft’s Patch Tuesday updates fix roughly 60 vulnerabilities found in the company’s products. The post 6 Actively Exploited Zero-Days Patched by Microsoft With February 2026 Updates appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: EU Unconditionally Approves Google’s $32B Acquisition of Wiz
item.description: The European Commission’s ruling is based on extensive feedback from customers and rival cloud security and infrastructure vendors. The post EU Unconditionally Approves Google’s $32B Acquisition of Wiz appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DPRK Operatives Impersonate Professionals on LinkedIn to Infiltrate Companies
item.description: The information technology (IT) workers associated with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) are now applying to remote positions using real LinkedIn accounts of individuals they're impersonating, marking a new escalation of the fraudulent scheme. "These profiles often have verified...

item.title: Patch Tuesday: Adobe Fixes 44 Vulnerabilities in Creative Apps
item.description: The company has fixed several critical vulnerabilities that can be exploited for arbitrary code execution. The post Patch Tuesday: Adobe Fixes 44 Vulnerabilities in Creative Apps appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Reco Raises $30 Million to Enhance AI SaaS Security
item.description: This investment comes less than 10 months after Reco’s last raise, bringing total funding to $85 million. The post Reco Raises $30 Million to Enhance AI SaaS Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vega Raises $120M in Series B Funding to Grow Security Analytics Platform
item.description: Led by existing investor Accel, with participation from Cyberstarts, Redpoint, and CRV, the Series B round brings the total amount raised by the company to $185 million. The post Vega Raises $120M in Series B Funding to Grow Security Analytics Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions
item.description: In September, Alfred Stephen, a freelance software developer in Singapore, purchased a ChatGPT Plus subscription, which costs $20 a month and offers more access to advanced models, to speed up his work. But he grew frustrated with the chatbot’s coding abilities and its gushing, meandering replies....

item.title: The Scientist and the Simulator
item.description: LLMs (alone) won’t cure cancer

item.title: Reynolds Ransomware Embeds BYOVD Driver to Disable EDR Security Tools
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of an emergent ransomware family dubbed Reynolds that comes embedded with a built-in bring your own vulnerable driver (BYOVD) component for defense evasion purposes within the ransomware payload itself. BYOVD refers to an adversarial technique that...

item.title: From Ransomware to Residency: Inside the Rise of the Digital Parasite
item.description: Are ransomware and encryption still the defining signals of modern cyberattacks, or has the industry been too fixated on noise while missing a more dangerous shift happening quietly all around them? According to Picus Labs’ new Red Report 2026, which analyzed over 1.1 million malicious files and...

item.title: The Download: Making AI Work, and why the Moltbook hype is similar to Pokémon
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. A first look at Making AI Work, MIT Technology Review’s new AI newsletter Are you interested in learning more about the ways in which AI is actually...

item.title: ZAST.AI Raises $6M Pre-A to Scale "Zero False Positive" AI-Powered Code Security
item.description: January 5, 2026, Seattle, USA — ZAST.AI announced the completion of a $6 million Pre-A funding round. This investment came from the well-known investment firm Hillhouse Capital, bringing ZAST.AI's total funding close to $10 million. This marks a recognition from leading capital markets of a new...

item.title: Opus 4.6 Fast Mode small amount of errors
item.description: Feb 10, 11:23 UTCInvestigating - Starting at about 02:05 PST Opus 4.6 Fast Mode serves a small amount of errors. We are investigating.

item.title: Warlock Ransomware Breaches SmarterTools Through Unpatched SmarterMail Server
item.description: SmarterTools confirmed last week that the Warlock (aka Storm-2603) ransomware gang breached its network by exploiting an unpatched SmarterMail instance. The incident took place on January 29, 2026, when a mail server that was not updated to the latest version was compromised, the company's Chief...

item.title: X-Humanoid Unveils Embodied Tiangong 3.0, Next-Generation General-Purpose Humanoid Robot
item.description: X-Humanoid launches Embodied Tiangong 3.0, the industry’s first full-size humanoid robot with touch-interactive, high-dynamic motion and an open development ecosystem.

item.title: Alibaba DAMO Academy Launches Embodied AI Brain Model RynnBrain
item.description: Alibaba DAMO Academy unveils RynnBrain, the first 30B MoE embodied AI brain, empowering robots with spatiotemporal memory and physical reasoning.

item.title: Huawei Pura X2 Upgrades to 16:10 Wide Screen, Focuses on Large-Screen Creativity and Multimedia Experience
item.description: Huawei’s Pura X2 adopts a 16:10 wide foldable screen and upgraded hardware to enhance creativity, multimedia, and tablet-like viewing experiences.

item.title: Noematrix Secures Series A Funding to Accelerate Embodied AI Development
item.description: Noematrix completes Series A financing to accelerate the development and real-world deployment of its versatile embodied AI solutions.

item.title: LLM-FSM: Scaling Large Language Models for Finite-State Reasoning in RTL Code Generation
item.description: arXiv:2602.07032v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Finite-state reasoning, the ability to understand and implement state-dependent behavior, is central to hardware design. In this paper, we present LLM-FSM, a benchmark that evaluates how well large language models (LLMs) can recover finite-state...

item.title: ST-Raptor: An Agentic System for Semi-Structured Table QA
item.description: arXiv:2602.07034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Semi-structured table question answering (QA) is a challenging task that requires (1) precise extraction of cell contents and positions and (2) accurate recovery of key implicit logical structures, hierarchical relationships, and semantic associations...

item.title: DLLM-Searcher: Adapting Diffusion Large Language Model for Search Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.07035v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, Diffusion Large Language Models (dLLMs) have demonstrated unique efficiency advantages, enabled by their inherently parallel decoding mechanism and flexible generation paradigm. Meanwhile, despite the rapid advancement of Search Agents,...

item.title: Aster: Autonomous Scientific Discovery over 20x Faster Than Existing Methods
item.description: arXiv:2602.07040v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce Aster, an AI agent for autonomous scientific discovery capable of operating over 20 times faster than existing frameworks. Given a task, an initial program, and a script to evaluate the performance of the program, Aster iteratively...

item.title: Theory of Space: Can Foundation Models Construct Spatial Beliefs through Active Exploration?
item.description: arXiv:2602.07055v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Spatial embodied intelligence requires agents to act to acquire information under partial observability. While multimodal foundation models excel at passive perception, their capacity for active, self-directed exploration remains understudied. We...

item.title: Attractor Patch Networks: Reducing Catastrophic Forgetting with Routed Low-Rank Patch Experts
item.description: arXiv:2602.06993v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Transformers achieve strong language modeling accuracy, yet their position-wise feed-forward networks (FFNs) are dense, globally shared, and typically updated end to end. These properties create two practical tensions. First, dense FFNs spend the same...

item.title: Neural Sabermetrics with World Model: Play-by-play Predictive Modeling with Large Language Model
item.description: arXiv:2602.07030v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Classical sabermetrics has profoundly shaped baseball analytics by summarizing long histories of play into compact statistics. While these metrics are invaluable for valuation and retrospective analysis, they do not define a generative model of how...

item.title: Lagged backward-compatible physics-informed neural networks for unsaturated soil consolidation analysis
item.description: arXiv:2602.07031v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This study develops a Lagged Backward-Compatible Physics-Informed Neural Network (LBC-PINN) for simulating and inverting one-dimensional unsaturated soil consolidation under long-term loading. To address the challenges of coupled air and water...

item.title: TransConv-DDPM: Enhanced Diffusion Model for Generating Time-Series Data in Healthcare
item.description: arXiv:2602.07033v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The lack of real-world data in clinical fields poses a major obstacle in training effective AI models for diagnostic and preventive tools in medicine. Generative AI has shown promise in increasing data volume and enhancing model training, particularly...

item.title: AVERE: Improving Audiovisual Emotion Reasoning with Preference Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.07054v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Emotion understanding is essential for building socially intelligent agents. Although recent multimodal large language models have shown strong performance on this task, two key challenges remain - spurious associations between emotions and irrelevant...

item.title: Can One-sided Arguments Lead to Response Change in Large Language Models?
item.description: arXiv:2602.06260v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Polemic questions need more than one viewpoint to express a balanced answer. Large Language Models (LLMs) can provide a balanced answer, but also take a single aligned viewpoint or refuse to answer. In this paper, we study if such initial responses...

item.title: Is my model "mind blurting"? Interpreting the dynamics of reasoning tokens with Recurrence Quantification Analysis (RQA)
item.description: arXiv:2602.06266v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Test-time compute is central to large reasoning models, yet analysing their reasoning behaviour through generated text is increasingly impractical and unreliable. Response length is often used as a brute proxy for reasoning effort, but this metric...

item.title: MPIB: A Benchmark for Medical Prompt Injection Attacks and Clinical Safety in LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2602.06268v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems are increasingly integrated into clinical workflows; however, prompt injection attacks can steer these systems toward clinically unsafe or misleading outputs. We introduce...

item.title: VowelPrompt: Hearing Speech Emotions from Text via Vowel-level Prosodic Augmentation
item.description: arXiv:2602.06270v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Emotion recognition in speech presents a complex multimodal challenge, requiring comprehension of both linguistic content and vocal expressivity, particularly prosodic features such as fundamental frequency, intensity, and temporal dynamics. Although...

item.title: RoPE-LIME: RoPE-Space Locality + Sparse-K Sampling for Efficient LLM Attribution
item.description: arXiv:2602.06275v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Explaining closed-source LLM outputs is challenging because API access prevents gradient-based attribution, while perturbation methods are costly and noisy when they depend on regenerated text. We introduce RoPE-LIME, an open-source extension of...

item.title: Next-Gen CAPTCHAs: Leveraging the Cognitive Gap for Scalable and Diverse GUI-Agent Defense
item.description: The rapid evolution of GUI-enabled agents has rendered traditional CAPTCHAs obsolete. While previous benchmarks like OpenCaptchaWorld established a baseline for evaluating multimodal agents, recent advancements in reasoning-heavy models, such as Gemini3-Pro-High and GPT-5.2-Xhigh have effectively...

item.title: From Obstacles to Etiquette: Robot Social Navigation with VLM-Informed Path Selection
item.description: Navigating socially in human environments requires more than satisfying geometric constraints, as collision-free paths may still interfere with ongoing activities or conflict with social norms. Addressing this challenge calls for analyzing interactions between agents and incorporating common-sense...

item.title: Learning to Coordinate via Quantum Entanglement in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The inability to communicate poses a major challenge to coordination in multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL). Prior work has explored correlating local policies via shared randomness, sometimes in the form of a correlation device, as a mechanism to assist in decentralized decision-making. In...
